pull.title: [Doc] Add benchmarking notes
pull.body: Benchmarking isn't really mentioned anywhere in the dev docs/notes, this adds a simple overview.

events.body: Nits fixed, however lets wait until #8115 is merged, I've updated the output to the newer formatting.

@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+Benchmarking
+============
+
+Bitcoin Core has an internal benchmarking framework, with benchmarks
+for cryptographic algorithms such as SHA1, SHA256, SHA512 and RIPMED160. As well as the rolling bloom filter.
+
+After compiling bitcoin-core, the benchmarks can be run with:
+`src/bench/bench_bitcoin`
+
+The output will look similar to:
+```
+Benchmark,count,min,max,average
+RIPEMD160,415,0.00244796,0.00267813,0.00247134
+RollingBloom-refresh,1,0.000696,0.000696,0.000696
+RollingBloom-refresh,1,0.000118,0.000118,0.000118
+RollingBloom,1441791,6.79691e-07,2.86102e-06,7.60326e-07
+SHA1,575,0.00178194,0.00191213,0.00181122
+SHA256,239,0.00426231,0.00447637,0.00429545
+SHA512,383,0.00259304,0.00280887,0.00262492
+Sleep100ms,10,0.10007,0.105038,0.103304
+Trig,46137343,0,9.53674e-07,2.19514e-08
+```
+
+More benchmarks are needed for, in no particular order:
+- Script Validation
+- CCoinDBView caching
+- Coins database
+- Memory pool
+- EncodeBase58 performance

@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+Benchmarking
+============
+
+Bitcoin Core has an internal benchmarking framework, with benchmarks
+for cryptographic algorithms such as SHA1, SHA256, SHA512 and RIPEMED160. As well as the rolling bloom filter.
